com.mobius.vdrapi
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.mobius.vdrapi.Session
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.mobius.vdrapi.IHasConnectionState, ISession
public class Session
extends Object
implements ISession, com.mobius.vdrapi.IHasConnectionState

A Session object represents a connection to one or more document servers.

Constructor Detail

Session

public Session(IDocumentServer serverToAttachTo,
               String userId,
               String requestedRecipient,
               String password,
               ViewDirectSeverityLevel traceThreshold,
               byte[] securityInfo,
               int securityType,
               byte[] sessionTicket,
               StringBuffer assignedRecipient)
        throws AuthenticationException,
               ViewDirectException
Constructor for creating a session.

Parameters:
serverToAttachTo - the document server object to which you want to connect.
userId - the user ID to use when connecting to the server.
requestedRecipient - the Recipient ID as defined in the distribution database.
password - the password to use when connecting to the server.
traceThreshold - code that configures the trace information to be logged for the document server.
securityInfo - the security settings to be applied to the session. It should be provided as a byte array of length Types.MAX_SECURITYDESCR_SIZE. If this parameter is not utilized, it should be passed a null value.

You can optionally use the securityInfo information and the securityType to implement security for an external (non-Mobius) security manager residing on the ViewDirect server. In this case, the information you specify in, and format of, the securityInfo and securityType is completely at your discretion. The securityInfo and securityType are passed to the server, which subsequently passes them to the security manager, if detected. The security manager performs security checks on the information, and allows or rejects the server connection accordingly.

For more information about providing customized authentication, refer to "Customizing Authentication Encryption/Decryption" in Appendix C of the DocumentDirect for the Internet User's Guide.

securityType - the appropriate security type. Use this parameter to supply additional security information that supplements the securityInfo data.

sessionTicket - the session ticket is both an input and an output parameter. It must be provided as a byte array of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET.

The session ticket enables users who have already been authenticated to bypass the server authentication process on subsequent attempts to connect to a server. This process works as follows:

  1. When a user first attempts to connect, a session ticket populated with blanks must be provided, and the server inititates the authentication procedure as usual.
  2. Upon successfully establishing a server session and completing the authentication process, the session ticket is filled in by the server and returned to the caller.
  3. When the user attempts to connect to server at a later time, the completed session ticket is provided, enabling the user to bypass the authentication process.

Session tickets can also be shared among servers. If servers in a group (sharing the same authentication key) are configured to permit single sign-on, then users who have logged on to one server are able to connect to the other servers in the group without having to provide separate login details. For more information about configuring document servers for single sign-on, refer to Chapter 13 of the ViewDirect for Networks User's Guide.

Note: Session tickets are supported on ViewDirect for MVS 6.2 servers or later, or ViewDirect for Networks 3.3 servers or later.

assignedRecipient - the Recipient ID assigned to the new session by the ViewDirect document server.
Throws:
AuthenticationException - thrown if there is a problem authenticating this user ID and password.
ViewDirectException - thrown if any other problem occurs.

Method Detail

attach

public boolean attach(IDocumentServer serverToAttachTo,
                      String userId,
                      String requestedRecipient,
                      String password,
                      ViewDirectSeverityLevel traceThreshold,
                      byte[] securityInfo,
                      int securityType,
                      byte[] sessionTicket,
                      StringBuffer assignedRecipient)
               throws AuthenticationException,
                      ViewDirectException
Enables connection to a document server. This method is only needed when connecting to multiple document servers. For single document server sessions, the constructor will create the lone connection required.

Specified by:
attach in interface ISession
Parameters:
serverToAttachTo - the document server object to which you want to connect.
userId - the user ID to use when connecting to the server.
requestedRecipient - recipient ID defined in the distribution database.
password - the password to use when connecting to the server.
traceThreshold - configures the trace information to be logged.
securityInfo - the security settings to be applied to the session. It should be provided as a byte array of length Types.MAX_SECURITYDESCR_SIZE. If this parameter is not utilized, it should be passed a null value.
securityType - the appropriate security type. Use this parameter to supply additional security information that supplements the securityInfo data.

You can optionally use the securityInfo information and the securityType to implement security for an external (non-Mobius) security manager residing on the ViewDirect server. In this case, the information you specify in, and format of, the securityInfo and securityType is completely at your discretion. The securityInfo and securityType are passed by the function to the server, which subsequently passes them to the security manager, if detected by the server. The security manager performs security checks on the information, and allows or rejects the server connection accordingly.

For more information about providing customized authentication, refer to "Customizing Authentication Encryption/Decryption" in Appendix C of the DocumentDirect for the Internet User's Guide.

sessionTicket - the session ticket is both an input and an output parameter, and must be provided as a byte array of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET.

The session ticket provides a way for users who have already been authenticated to bypass the server authentication process on subsequent attempts to connect to a server. This process works as follows:

  1. When a user first attempts to connect, a session ticket populated with blanks must be provided, and the server inititates the authentication procedure as usual.
  2. Upon successfully establishing a server session and completing the authentication process, the session ticket is filled in by the server and returned to the caller.
  3. When the user attempts to connect to server at a later time, the completed session ticket is provided, enabling the user to bypass the authentication process.

Session tickets can also be shared among servers. If servers in a group (sharing the same authentication key) are configured to permit single sign-on, then users who have logged on to one server are able to connect to the other servers in the group without having to provide separate login details. For more information about configuring document servers for single sign-on, refer to Chapter 13 of the ViewDirect for Networks User's Guide.

Note: Session tickets are supported on ViewDirect for MVS 6.2 servers or later, or ViewDirect for Networks 3.3 servers or later.

assignedRecipient - the recipient ID assigned to the new session by the ViewDirect document server.
Returns:
a Boolean value indicating the success or failure of the connection.
Throws:
AuthenticationException - thrown if there is a problem authenticating this user ID and password.
ViewDirectException - thrown if any other problem occurs.

createListFactory

public IListFactory createListFactory(SessionFactoryType factoryType)
                               throws FactoryTypeNotSupportedException,
                                      SessionNotOpenException,
                                      ViewDirectException
Creates the various top level factories.

Specified by:
createListFactory in interface ISession
Parameters:
factoryType - type of factory you wish to create. If this factory type is not supported, a FactoryTypeNotSupportedException is thrown.
Returns:
the factory created. The class can use this factory to generate a list of INode objects, with the specific INode objects available determined by the factory type.
Throws:
FactoryTypeNotSupportedException - thrown if this factory type is not supported for one or more of the attached IDocumentServer objects.
SessionNotOpenException - thrown if there are no attached document servers.
ViewDirectException - thrown if any other error occurs.
